result.execSummary:
The defendant Jervell D. Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jervell D. Jones is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jervell D. Jones was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  DV Counseling.
*   Pay fine of $250 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*    Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100  ea applicable count).
May not have VIOLENT contact with Lashia H.

records.addlTxt: Revoked - Sentenced to KCJ on 9/15/15

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:52am-  Matter heard with 15CM364.  Victim rights compliance.  Defendant is sentenced to 9 months in the Kenosha County Jail w/ huber - concurrent to 15CM364 & 15CM760.  Credit for 90 days.  Any previously ordered fines & costs are reimposed - due in 30 days or civil judgment.  Appeal rights given.
Notice of Hearing returned for Arlisha Johnson.  Vacant.  Unable to forward.

Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:03pm-  Matter heard with 15CM364.  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  Defendant entered a plea of no contest to count 1; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, counts 2 & 3 are dismissed.  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions - concurrent to 15CM364.  2 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court orders $250.00 fine plus costs & DV surcharge.  NO DNA SURCHARGE.  Appeal rights given.  Defendant may petition the court for expungement, in writing, after 12 months upon successful completion of probation & if the DE does not violate any state or federal laws.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
